message.content:
To align a row of `div`s to the right using flex, we can use the `justify-content` property with the value `flex-end`. Here's an example code snippet: ```html
``` In the above example, we have created a container `div` with four child `div`s inside it. We set its display property to flex and justified them to the right using `justify-content: flex-end`. Each item has a width of 50px and height of 50px, and a margin of 10px between them for spacing. You can adjust these values as per your requirements. The result will look like this: ![flex-align-right](https://i.imgur.com/JYf9NxQI.png)
